citation_title: A Model of Endogenous Fiscal Deficits and Delayed Fiscal Reforms
topics:
Macroeconomics

Fiscal Policy

Public Economics

Taxation
abstract: This paper develops a political-economic model of fiscal policy one in which" government resources are a  common property' out of which interest groups can finance" expenditures on their preferred items.  This setup has striking macroeconomic implications. " First, fiscal deficits and debt accumulation occur even when there are no reasons for intertemporal smoothing.  Second deficits can be eliminated through a fiscal reform, but such a reform may only take place after a" delay during which government debt is built up.
